results.title: Risk of Non-infectious Uveitis with Metformin Therapy in a Large Healthcare Claims Database.
results.text_hl: PURPOSE: To determine if @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ is associated with @<m>DISEASE_Noncommunicable_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000073296 @@@noninfectious@@@ @DISEASE_Uveitis @DISEASE_MESH:D014605 @@@uveitis@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Noncommunicable_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000073296 @@@NIU@@@).

results.title: A randomized controlled trial of Mediterranean diet and metformin to prevent age-related diseases in people with metabolic syndrome.
results.text_hl: We designed a phase III randomized controlled trial (the Me.Me.Me trial) to evaluate the effect of a comprehensive lifestyle intervention (including moderate physical activity and a Mediterranean-macrobiotic diet) and the effect of treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in the prevention of @<m>DISEASE_Noncommunicable_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000073296 @@@ArCDs@@@ in healthy people with @DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@MetS.@@@ This report describes the scientific protocol of this trial.

citations.NLM: Pasanisi P, Gargano G, Gaetana Di Mauro M, Cortellini M, Casagrande A, Villarini A, Bruno E, Roveda E, Saibene G, Venturelli E, Berrino F. A randomized controlled trial of Mediterranean diet and metformin to prevent age-related diseases in people with metabolic syndrome. Tumori. 2018 Mar-Apr;104(2):137-142. PMID: 28106245

results.title: Evaluating medicine prices, availability and affordability in Bangladesh using World Health Organisation and Health Action International methodology
results.text_hl: Availability and affordability of @<m>DISEASE_Noncommunicable_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000073296 @@@NCD@@@ medicines are key concerns where the burden of @<m>DISEASE_Noncommunicable_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000073296 @@@NCD@@@ is rising.

results.title: A management system for randomized clinical trials: A novel way to supply medication
results.text_hl: Me.Me.Me. is an ongoing phase III randomized controlled trial in healthy people with @DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@metabolic syndrome@@@ to test the hypothesis that comprehensive lifestyle changes and/or @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ can prevent age-related chronic @<m>DISEASE_Noncommunicable_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000073296 @@@non-communicable diseases@@@.

A management system for randomized clinical trials: A novel way to supply medication PLoS One. 2019;14(2):e0212475. PMID: 30794607
